In response to a claim that the FWD.us organization is "just about tech wanting to hire more people", the Internet entrepreneur replied: "The bigger problem we're trying to address is ensuring the 11 million undocumented folks living in this country now and similar folks in the future are treated fairly."{{cite web |title=Zuckerberg Replies To His Facebook Commenters' Questions On Immigration |url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/06/20/zuckerberg-immigration-reform/?ncid=tcdaily |work=TechCrunch |publisher=Aol Tech|access-date=June 20, 2013 |first=Josh |last=Constine |date=June 20, 2013}} In June 2013, Zuckerberg joined Facebook employees in a company float as part of the annual [[San Francisco Pride|San Francisco Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Pride Celebration]]. The company first participated in the event in 2011, with 70 employees, and this number increased to 700 for the 2013 march. The 2013 pride celebration was especially significant, as it followed a [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] ruling that deemed the [[Defense of Marriage Act]] (DOMA) unconstitutional.{{cite web |title=Mark Zuckerberg 'Likes' SF LGBT Pride As Tech Companies Publicly Celebrate Equal Rights |url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/06/30/tech-pride/?ncid=tcdaily |work=TechCrunch |publisher=AOL Inc|access-date=July 2, 2013 |first=Billy |last=Gallagher |date=June 30, 2013}}{{cite news |title=Mark Zuckerberg Leads 700 Facebook Employees in SF Gay Pride |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/digits/2013/06/30/mark-zuckerberg-leads-700-facebook-employees-in-sf-gay-pride/|access-date=July 2, 2013 |newspaper=The Wall Street Journal |date=June 30, 2013 |author=Evelyn M. Rusli}} [[File:Secretary Kerry Shakes Hands With Facebook CEO Zuckerberg Before Their Meeting at Facebook's New Headquarters in Menlo Park (27862589425).jpg|thumb|230px|Zuckerberg and U.S. Secretary of State [[John Kerry]], 2016]] When questioned about the mid-2013 [[PRISM (surveillance program)|PRISM]] scandal at the TechCrunch Disrupt conference in September 2013, Zuckerberg stated that the U.S. government "blew it." He further explained that the government performed poorly in regard to the protection of the freedoms of its citizens, the economy, and companies. Zuckerberg placed a statement on his Facebook wall on December 9, 2015 which said that he wants "to add my voice in support of Muslims in our community and around the world" in response to the [[Donald Trump presidential campaign, 2016#Policies targeting Muslims|aftermath]] of the [[November 2015 Paris attacks]] and the [[2015 San Bernardino attack]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thewrap.com/mark-zuckerberg-vows-to-fight-to-protect-muslim-rights-on-facebook/ |title=Mark Zuckerberg Vows to 'Fight to Protect' Muslim Rights on Facebook|access-date=December 10, 2015 |last=Emery |first=Debbie |date=December 9, 2015 |publisher=[[TheWrap]]}}{{cite web |url=http://time.com/4143858/mark-zuckerberg-muslims/ |title=Mark Zuckerberg Offers Support to Muslims in Facebook Post|access-date=December 10, 2015 |last=White |first=Daniel |date=December 9, 2015 |work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/dec/10/mark-zuckerberg-support-muslims-donald-trump |title=Mark Zuckerberg speaks in support of Muslims after week of 'hate'|access-date=December 10, 2015 |last=Griffin |first=Andrew |date=December 9, 2015 |work=[[The Guardian]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BYunhjsmTqM |title=Mark Zuckerberg Stands With Muslims|access-date=December 11, 2015 |last=[[Cenk Uygur]] |date=December 10, 2015 |publisher=[[The Young Turks]]}} The statement also said that Muslims are "always welcome" on Facebook, and that his position was a result of the fact that "[[Jewish culture|as a Jew]], my parents taught me that we must stand up against attacks on all communities."{{cite web |url=http://www.haaretz.com/jewish/features/1.691209 |title=Zuckerberg Invokes Jewish Heritage in Facebook Post Supporting Muslims|access-date=December 10, 2015 |date=December 10, 2015 |work=[[Haaretz]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/donald-trump/12043025/Mark-Zuckerberg-voices-support-for-Muslims-amid-Donald-Trump-ban-row.html |title=Mark Zuckerberg voices support for Muslims amid Donald Trump ban row|access-date=December 10, 2015 |last=Tait |first=Robert |date=December 9, 2015 |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]}} On February 24, 2016, Zuckerberg sent out a company-wide internal memo to employees formally rebuking employees who had crossed out handwritten "[[Black Lives Matter]]" phrases on the company walls and had written "All Lives Matter" in their place. Facebook allows employees to free-write thoughts and phrases on company walls. The memo was then leaked by several employees. As Zuckerberg had previously condemned this practice at previous company meetings, and other similar requests had been issued by other leaders at Facebook, Zuckerberg wrote in the memo that he would now consider this overwriting practice not only disrespectful, but "malicious as well." According to Zuckerberg's memo, "''Black Lives Matter'' doesn't mean other lives don't -- it's simply asking that the black community also achieves the justice they deserve." The memo also noted that the act of crossing something out in itself, "means silencing speech, or that one person's speech is more important than another's." Zuckerberg also said in the memo that he would be launching investigations into the incidents.{{cite news |last1=King |first1=Shaun |title=Mark Zuckerberg forced to address racism among Facebook staff after vandals target Black Lives Matter phrases |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/king-mark-zuckerberg-forced-address-racism-facebook-article-1.2543985|access-date=February 26, 2016 |agency=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]|location=New York |date=February 25, 2016}}{{cite news |last1=Jessica |first1=Guynn |title=Zuckerberg reprimands Facebook staff defacing 'Black Lives Matter' slogan |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/news/2016/02/25/facebook-mark-zuckerberg-black-lives-matter-diversity/80933694/|access-date=February 26, 2016 |work=[[USA Today]] |date=February 25, 2016}}{{cite news |last1=Snyder |first1=Benjamin |title=Mark Zuckerberg Takes Facebook Workers to Task Over 'All Lives Matter' Graffiti |url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/25/mark-zuckerberg-black-lives-matter/|access-date=February 26, 2016 |work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] |date=February 25, 2016}} New York's ''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]'' interviewed Facebook employees who commented anonymously that, "Zuckerberg was genuinely angry about the incident and it really encouraged staff that Zuckerberg showed a clear understanding of why the phrase 'Black Lives Matter' must exist, as well as why writing through it is a form of harassment and erasure." In January 2017, Zuckerberg criticized Donald Trump's [[Executive order (United States)|executive order]] to severely limit immigrants and refugees from some countries.theguardian.com January 28, 2017: [https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/jan/27/mark-zuckerberg-donald-trump-immigration-order-facebook ''Mark Zuckerberg challenges Trump on immigration and 'extreme vetting' order ''] ==Personal life== Zuckerberg met his future wife, fellow student [[Priscilla Chan Zuckerberg|Priscilla Chan]], at a fraternity party during his sophomore year at Harvard. They began dating in 2003.{{citation |first=Clare |last=O'Connor |title=Mark Zuckerberg's Wife Priscilla Chan: A New Brand of Billionaire Bride |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2012/05/20/mark-zuckerbergs-wife-priscilla-chan-a-new-brand-of-billionaire-bride/ |work=Forbes |date=May 20, 2012|access-date=May 21, 2012}}{{citation |title=Status Update: Mark Zuckerberg is married to Priscilla Chan |url=http://techstroke.com/status-update-mark-zuckerberg-marries-priscilla-chan/ |publisher=Techstroke |date=May 20, 2012|access-date=May 21, 2012}} In September 2010, Zuckerberg invited Chan, by then a medical student at the [[University of California, San Francisco|University of California]],[http://medschool2.ucsf.edu/spotlights/white-coats-rainbow-students "White Coats on a Rainbow of Students"], ''Spotlight'', UCSF School of Medicine. Cf. Priscilla Chan, 23. to move into his rented Palo Alto house. Zuckerberg studied [[Standard Chinese|Mandarin]] in preparation for the couple's visit to China in December 2010.{{cite news |url=http://www.ecommercetimes.com/story/Zuckerberg-Goes-Searching-in-China-71499.html?wlc=1292882576 |title=Zuckerberg Goes Searching in China |first=Rob |last=Spiegel |date=December 20, 2010}}{{cite web |work=ChineseTime.cn |url=http://www.chinesetime.cn/learn/chinese/forum/tabid/119/forumid/-1/postid/4618/scope/posts/language/en-US/Default.aspx |title=Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg learn chinese every morning |date=September 29, 2010}} On May 19, 2012, Zuckerberg and Chan married in Zuckerberg's backyard in an event that also celebrated her graduation from medical school.{{cite news |last=Stein |first=Joel |title=Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg marries sweetheart |url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_FACEBOOK_CEO_MARRIED?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2012-05-19-21-31-02|access-date=May 19, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120524030904/http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_FACEBOOK_CEO_MARRIED?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2012-05-19-21-31-02 |archivedate=May 24, 2012 |df=mdy-all}}{{cite news |title=Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg marries Priscilla Chan |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-501465_162-57437780-501465/facebooks-mark-zuckerberg-marries-priscilla-chan/|access-date=May 20, 2012 |publisher=CBS News}}{{cite news |first=Marcus |last=Wohlsen |title=Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg marries longtime girlfriend, Priscilla Chan: Palo Alto, Calif., ceremony caps busy week after company goes public |date=May 19, 2012 |agency=Associated Press |publisher=MSNBC |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/47491836/ns/business/?gt1=54001|access-date=May 20, 2012}} On July 31, 2015, Zuckerberg announced that he and Chan were expecting a baby girl. He said he felt confident that the risk of [[miscarriage|miscarrying]] was low so far into the pregnancy, after Chan had already suffered three miscarriages.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-33743740 |title=Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg to become a father |publisher=[[BBC News]] |date=July 31, 2015 |access-date=August 1, 2015}} On December 1, Zuckerberg announced the birth of their daughter, Maxima Chan Zuckerberg ("Max").{{cite web |title=The Switch Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan to give away 99 percent of their Facebook stock, worth $45 billion |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2015/12/01/mark-zuckerberg-will-give-away-99-percent-of-his-facebook-stock/}}{{Cite web |title=A letter to our daughter |url=https://www.facebook.com/notes/mark-zuckerberg/a-letter-to-our-daughter/10153375081581634 |website=''facebook.com''|access-date = December 1, 2015}} The couple announced on their [[Chinese New Year]] video, published on February 6, 2016, that Maxima's official Chinese name is Chen Mingyu ({{zh|陈明宇}}).{{cite web |last1=Kell |first1=John |title=Mark Zuckerberg Reveals Daughter's Chinese Name |url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/08/facebook-zuckerberg-daughter/ |website=Fortune|access-date=February 29, 2016 |date=February 8, 2016 |quote=In a pretty adorable video shared by the tech executive over the weekend, Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan said their daughter Max's Chinese name is Chen Mingyu.}} They welcomed their second daughter, August, in August 2017.{{cite news |title=Mark Zuckerberg and his wife just unveiled their new baby girl to the world |date=August 28, 2017 |accessdate=August 28, 2017 |url=http://www.foxnews.com/tech/2017/08/28/mark-zuckerberg-and-his-wife-just-unveiled-their-new-baby-girl-to-world.html |publisher=Fox News Channel}} Zuckerberg has also been very active in China, and he has been a member of [[Tsinghua University]] business school's advisory board since 2014.{{Cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/mark-zuckerberg-visits-china-as-facebook-eyes-realistic-opportunity-to-enter-country-in-2018-2017-10 |title=Mark Zuckerberg is back in China as Facebook eyes opportunity to finally enter the country |website=Business Insider |date=October 28, 2017}} Zuckerberg was raised Jewish but later identified as an [[atheist]],{{cite news |last=Vara |first=Vauhini |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB119621309736406034 |title=Just How Much Do We Want to Share On Social Networks? |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=November 28, 2007|access-date=December 30, 2016}}{{cite book |author1=Daniel Alef |title=Mark Zuckerberg: The Face Behind Facebook and Social Networking |date=October 17, 2010 |publisher=Titans of Fortune Publishing |isbn=9781608043118 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=z2z9y4uOy1QC&lpg=PP1&dq=Mark%20Zuckerberg%3A%20The%20Face%20Behind%20Facebook%20and%20Social%20Networking&pg=PP6#v=onepage&q=atheist&f=false|access-date=December 30, 2016}} a position he has since renounced. He has shown an appreciation for [[Buddhism]].{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-injects-buddhism-into-business-2013-6 |title=Facebook Is Injecting Buddhism Into Its Core Business So It Can Be More Compassionate | access-date=June 25, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lionsroar.com/mark-zuckerberg-says-buddhism-is-an-amazing-religion/ |title=Mark Zuckerberg says "Buddhism is an amazing religion| access-date=October 27, 2015}} With regard to Christianity, both Zuckerberg and his wife told [[Pope Francis]] in August 2016 "how much we admire his message of mercy and tenderness, and how he's found new ways to communicate with people of every faith around the world."{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2016/08/29/pope-francis-and-facebooks-mark-zuckerberg-had-a-meeting-today/ |title=Pope Francis and Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg had a meeting today - The Washington Post |last=Zauzmer |first=Julie |date=August 29, 2016 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |access-date=January 7, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/08/mark-zuckerberg-pope-francis |title=Mark Zuckerberg Gives the Pope an Unusual Gift |last=Fox |first=Emily Jane |date=August 29, 2016 |work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |access-date=January 7, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.americamagazine.org/issue/mark-zuckerberg-gets-facebook-time-pope-francis |title=Pope meets with Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg |last=Esteves |first=Junno Arocho |date=August 29, 2016 |work=[[America (magazine)|America]] |access-date=January 7, 2017}} In December 2016, when asked "Aren't you an atheist?" in response to a [[Christmas Day]] post on Facebook, Zuckerberg responded, "No. I was raised Jewish and then I went through a period where I questioned things, but now I believe religion is very important."{{cite news |author1=Julie Zauzmer |title=Mark Zuckerberg says he's no longer an atheist, believes 'religion is very important' |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2016/12/30/mark-zuckerberg-says-hes-no-longer-an-atheist-believes-religion-is-very-important/|access-date=December 30, 2016 |work=The Washington Post |date=December 30, 2016}} As he closed his [[History and traditions of Harvard commencements|commencement address]] at [[Harvard University]] in May 2017, Zuckerberg shared the Jewish prayer ''Mi Shebeirach'', which he stated he says when he faces challenges in life.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2017/05/25/mark-zuckerberg-shares-the-prayer-he-says-to-his-daughter-every-night/ |title=Mark Zuckerberg shares the prayer he says to his daughter every night - |last=Bailey |first=Sarah Pulliam |date=May 25, 2017 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |quote=Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg gave the commencement address at Harvard University on Thursday, closing his speech by sharing a Jewish prayer called the "Mi Shebeirach," which he said he recites whenever he faces a big challenge and which he sings to his daughter, thinking of her future, when he tucks her in at night.}}{{cite web |url=http://www.faithwire.com/2017/05/26/after-abandoning-atheism-facebook-founder-mark-zuckerberg-reveals-the-prayer-he-sings-to-his-daughter-every-night-before-bed/ |title=After Abandoning Atheism, Facebook Founder Mark Zuckerberg Reveals the Prayer He Sings to His Daughter Every Night Before Bed |last=Hallowell |first=Billy |date=May 26, 2017 |publisher=Faithwire |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |quote=It was during Zuckerberg's commencement address at Harvard University that he shared a Jewish prayer called the "Mi Shebeirach"— an invocation that he said he recites as he copes with major challenges in life and also when he tucks his child in at night, the Washington Post reported.}} ==See also== * [[Criticism of Facebook]] * [[Mark Zuckerberg book club]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} {{Commons category|Mark Zuckerberg}} * {{Facebook}} * {{IMDb name}} * [https://www.forbes.com/profile/mark-zuckerberg/ Mark Zuckerberg - {{Orphan|date=April 2017}} [[File:MBoninsegni photo Trieste 2017.jpg|thumb|Massimo Boninsegni in Trieste in 2017]] '''Massimo Boninsegni''' is an Italian Canadian [[Theoretical condensed matter physics|theoretical condensed matter physicist]]. Born in [[Genoa|Genova]] (Italy) in 1963, he graduated with a Bachelor's degree in physics at the [[Universita degli Studi di Genova|Universita' degli Studi di Genova]] in 1986.
He moved to the United States in 1987, where he received a [[Doctor of Philosophy|doctoral degree in physics]] from [[Florida State University]]. His [https://inis.iaea.org/search/search.aspx?orig_q=RN:25035971 Ph.D. thesis] was on numerical studies of a [[T-J_model|strongly correlated electronic model]] of [[High-temperature_superconductivity|high-temperature superconductivity]]. He took on postdoctoral positions at the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign|University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign]] and [[University of Delaware]], before becoming in 1997 an assistant professor of physics at [[San Diego State University]]. He moved to the [[University of Alberta]] in 2002, where he has been a professor of physics since 2005. In 2008 he became a Canadian citizen.
[http://massimo.physics.ualberta.ca His research interests] are in the areas of [[superfluidity]], [[superconductivity]], [[Bose Einstein Condensation|Bose-Einstein condensation]] and [[Quantum Monte Carlo|Quantum Monte Carlo simulations]]. His most important contribution is in computational [[Many-body_problem|quantum many-body physics]], specifically to the development of the continuous-space Worm Algorithm for the simulation of strongly correlated [[Boson|Bose systems]] at finite temperature.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Boninsegni|first=Massimo|last2=Prokof'ev|first2=Nikolay V.|last3=Svistunov|first3=Boris V.|date=February 2006|title=Worm Algorithm for Continuous-Space Path Integral Monte Carlo Simulations|url=https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.96.070601|journal=Physical Review Letters|volume=96|pages=070601|doi=10.1103/PhysRevLett.96.070601|via=|arxiv=cond-mat/0510214|bibcode=2006PhRvL..96g0601B}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Boninsegni|first=Massimo|last2=Prokof'ev|first2=Nikolay V.|last3=Svistunov|first3=Boris V.|date=|title=Worm algorithm and diagrammatic Monte Carlo: A new approach to continuous-space path integral Monte Carlo simulations|url=https://journals.aps.org/pre/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevE.74.036701|journal=Physical Review E|volume=74|pages=036701|doi=10.1103/PhysRevE.74.036701|via=|arxiv=physics/0605225|bibcode=2006PhRvE..74c6701B}}</ref> He also contributed to the study of the condensed phase of molecular hydrogen, chiefly the superfluid properties of small clusters,<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Mezzacapo|first=Fabio|last2=Boninsegni|first2=Massimo|date=March 2009|title=Classical and quantum physics of hydrogen clusters|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0953-8984/21/16/164205/meta;jsessionid=3813969B031D5F05DD316BE866411FBF.c1.iopscience.cld.iop.org|journal=Journal of Physics: Condensed Matter|volume=21|pages=164205|doi=10.1088/0953-8984/21/16/164205|via=|bibcode=2009JPCM...21p4205M}}</ref> as well as of the [[Supersolid|supersolid phase of matter]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Boninsegni|first=Massimo|last2=Prokof'ev|first2=Nikolay V.|date=April 2012|title=Supersolids: What and where are they?|url=https://journals.aps.org/rmp/abstract/10.1103/RevModPhys.84.759|journal=Reviews of Modern Physics|volume=84|pages=759-776|doi=10.1103/RevModPhys.84.759|via=|arxiv=1201.2227|bibcode=2012RvMP...84..759B}}</ref>
He was awarded the status of Fellow<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.aps.org/programs/honors/fellowships/|title=APS Fellowship|website=www.aps.org|language=en|access-date=2017-04-20}}</ref> of the [[American Physical Society]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.aps.org/programs/honors/fellowships/archive-all.cfm?initial=&year=&unit_id=&institution=|title=APS Fellow Archive|website=www.aps.org|language=en|access-date=2017-04-20}}</ref> after being nominated by the [https://www.aps.org/units/dcomp/ Division of Computational Physics] in 2007,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.aps.org/programs/honors/fellowships/archive-all.cfm?initial=&year=2007&unit_id=&institution=|title=APS Fellows 2007|last=|first=|date=|website=www.aps.org|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-04-20}}</ref> for ``''the development of a novel methodology enabling accurate, large-scale Quantum Monte Carlo simulations of interacting many-body systems, and for its application to the investigation of the supersolid phase of helium and of superfluidity of molecular hydrogen''.’’
Massimo Boninsegni is an [[Atheism|atheist]] and [http://expbook.wordpress.com science blogger].

{{Use mdy dates|date=March 2014}} {{Use American English|date=December 2013}} [[File:McStay family.jpg|thumb|right|alt=Photos of two adults and two young children|Missing-persons flier for the McStay family]]
The '''McStay family''' was an American family found murdered in the desert near [[Victorville, California]], on November 13, 2013. The family disappeared from their home in [[Fallbrook, California]], on February 4, 2010.<ref name=timeline>{{cite web|last=Figueroa |first=Teri |url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/Nov/15/timeline-mcstay-disappearance-case/ |title=How the McStay case unfolded |work=U-T San Diego |date=November 15, 2013 |accessdate=December 1, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203005025/http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/Nov/15/timeline-mcstay-disappearance-case/ |archivedate=December 3, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="nbcsandiego1">{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/Timeline-McStay-Family-Mystery-Fallbrook-Disappearance--232068061.html |title=Timeline: McStay Family Mystery |publisher=NBC 7 San Diego |date=November 16, 2013 |accessdate=December 1, 2013}}</ref> The McStays' disappearance was widely reported on national news stations and on ''[[America's Most Wanted]]'', ''[[Disappeared (TV series)|Disappeared]]'', ''[[Nancy Grace (TV series)|Nancy Grace]]'', and ''[[Unsolved Mysteries]]''.<ref name="nbcsandiego1" /> On November 7, 2014, police announced they had arrested Charles "Chase" Merritt, Joseph McStay's business partner, and intended to charge him with the murders;<ref name="Los Angeles Times">{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-mcstay-family-new-details-20141107-story.html |title=Business partner arrested in McStay family slaying, desert burial|work=Los Angeles Times|date=November 7, 2014}}</ref> {{As of|2018|05|lc=y}} the trial is scheduled to begin in July 2018.
== Background == In 2010, Joseph McStay (age 40) and his wife Summer (age 43) lived in Fallbrook, California, with their sons Gianni (age 4) and Joseph Jr. (age 3).<ref>{{cite news|last=Ramsey|first=Debbie|title=Authorities distribute 'endangered missing' flier pertaining to missing McStay family|url=http://www.thevillagenews.com/story/45499/|newspaper=Fallbrook Bonsall Village News|date=February 25, 2010}}</ref> Joseph owned and operated Earth Inspired Products, a company that built decorative fountains, and Summer was a licensed real estate agent.<ref name="Rojas">{{cite web|last=Rojas |first=Rick |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-victorville-bodies-mcstay-families-20131114,0,5975246.story |title=Buried bodies identified as members of missing McStay family |work=Los Angeles Times |date=November 15, 2013 |accessdate=December 1, 2013}}</ref>
== Disappearance == On February 4, 2010, at 7:47 pm, a neighbor's [[Surveillance camera|surveillance system]] captured the bottom 18 inches of a vehicle, thought at the time to be the McStay family's 1996 [[Isuzu Trooper]].<ref>{{cite news |first1=Teri |last1=Figueroa |first2=John |last2=Wilkens |url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/lifestyle/people/sdut-mcstay-missing-fallbrook-family-2013feb02-story.html |title=The McStays: A lingering mystery |newspaper=San Diego Union-Tribune |date=February 2, 2013 }}</ref> In the surveillance recording, the vehicle's occupants could not be seen.<ref name=timeline/> At 8:28 pm, a call was placed from Joseph McStay's cell phone to his business associate, Chase Merritt. The call went to voice mail. Merritt later told police that he ignored it because he was watching a movie. Joseph's cellphone pinged a tower in Fallbrook.<ref name=Polygraph>{{cite news|last=Linthicum|first=Kate|title=Man last phoned by McStay father says he took polygraph test|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/nov/20/local/la-me-ln-mcstay-family-mystery-20131120|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=November 20, 2013}}</ref>
Over the next several days, the McStays' family unsuccessfully tried to contact them. On February 13, Joseph's brother, Michael McStay traveled to the McStay residence and on finding an open window in back, climbed in and gained entry to the home. Michael McStay did not find any of the McStay family at home, and their two dogs were in the backyard. On February 15, he phoned the [[San Diego County Sheriff's Department|San Diego Sheriff's Department]] and reported his brother and family missing. Officers arrived to the home and requested a search warrant, executed on February 19, 2010. Although a search of the home found no evidence of struggle or [[Murder|foul play]], there were indications of a hasty departure: a carton of raw eggs had been left on the counter and two child-size bowls of popcorn sat on a sofa.<ref name = "nbcsandiego1" /><ref>{{cite news|last=Falcon|first=Gabriel|title=Three years later, no sign of missing|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/26/justice/mcstay-family-disappearance/|publisher=CNN|date=January 26, 2013}}</ref>
During their investigation, the police learned that at 11 pm on February 8, the family's Trooper had been towed from a [[strip mall]] parking lot in [[San Ysidro, San Diego]], near the Mexican border. It was believed to have been parked there between 5:30 and 7:00 that evening. The car's location from February 4 to February 8 is unknown.<ref name=Kraft>{{cite news|last=Kraft|first=Scott|title=Where did the McStays go?|url= http://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/Timeline-McStay-Family-Mystery-Fallbrook-Disappearance--232068061.html|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=May 30, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Stickney|first=R.|title=Timeline: McStay Family Mystery|newspaper=NBC San Diego|url=http://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/Timeline-McStay-Family-Mystery-Fallbrook-Disappearance--232068061.html|date=November 16, 2013}}</ref>
== {{anchor|Discovery of the remains}}Discovery of remains == On November 11, 2013, a motorcyclist found four sets of human remains buried in two shallow graves in the desert near [[Victorville, California]]. Patrick McStay, Joseph's father, was informed of the discovery and phoned missing person advocate Jerrie Dean of Missing Persons of America to tell her what he knew.<ref name="Mcstay Memorial erected in Victorville">{{cite web|url=http://fox5sandiego.com/2013/11/20/mcstay-memorial-erected-in-victorville/|title=McStay memorial erected in Victorville|work=FOX News Local|date=November 20, 2013}}</ref> Jerrie Dean stated in her blog she had just finished producing a radio show for [[KNSJ]] when she received the phone call, and that she asked whether she could tell her followers what he had told her. Two days later, two sets of remains were officially identified as those of Joseph and Summer McStay.<ref name="nbcsandiego1"/><ref name="Rojas"/> The deaths were ruled a homicide and San Bernardino County authorities said they believed the family died of blunt force trauma inside their home, but declined to discuss specifics of the deaths or a motive.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/11/08/us/mcstay-suspect-chase-merritt/ |title='I have absolutely no clue' on McStay family's slaying, Merritt said in interview |publisher=CNN |accessdate=January 6, 2014}}</ref>
Days after the discovery of the bodies, Joseph McStay's father said the San Diego Sheriff's Department investigation was faulty. He filed formal complaints in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/mcstay-family-disappearance-probe-botched-angry-relative-article-1.1519082 |title=Father of Joseph McStay calls the San Diego Sheriff's department investigation of missing family 'botched' and 'inept' |work=Daily News|location=New York |accessdate=December 1, 2013}}</ref>
=={{anchor|Reaction to the disappearance}}Reaction and investigation== The circumstances surrounding the family's disappearance and the lack of clues about their whereabouts triggered speculation by amateur sleuths. [[Radio host]] Rick Baker published a book, ''No Goodbyes: The Mysterious Disappearance of the McStay Family''.<ref name="Baker book">{{cite book|last=Baker|first=Rick|title=No Goodbyes: The Mysterious Disappearance of the McStay Family|date=February 4, 2013|publisher=Tate Publishing|isbn=1625104219|url=https://www.amazon.com/No-Goodbyes-Mysterious-Disappearance-McStay/dp/1625104219/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1392682861&sr=8-1&keywords=McStay+family}}</ref> Baker began following the case in 2013, after interviewing Joseph's brother, Michael, on his program. He conducted dozens of interviews on the case (traveling to [[Belize]], [[Mexico]], [[Haiti]] and the [[Dominican Republic]]), followed leads and reported sightings of the family. In the book he speculated that Summer McStay might have committed the murders. When the bodies were found, he offered a refund to those who purchased his book before November 2013.<ref name="San Diego">{{cite news|title=Author of McStay book criticized by victim's family|url=http://fox5sandiego.com/2013/11/18/author-of-mcstay-book-criticized-by-victims-family/|agency=Fox 5 San Diego |date=November 18, 2013 }}</ref>
After their disappearance, it was speculated that the McStays left voluntarily, since investigators found searches on the family's computers for "What documents do children need for traveling to Mexico?" and Spanish language lessons.<ref name="disappearance deepens">{{cite news|last=Rojas|first=Rick|title=After discovery, mystery of McStay family's disappearance deepens|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/la-me-victorville-bodies-20131116,0,4073608.story|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=November 15, 2013}}</ref> Because their car was found so close to the Mexican border, police reviewed surveillance footage of the pedestrian gate into Mexico. Video recorded the evening of February 8, released on March 5, showed a family of four resembling the McStays crossing the border into Mexico. On February 19, 2010, California police notified [[Interpol]] to be on the lookout for the family.<ref name = "nbcsandiego1" /> In April 2013, the [[San Diego County Sheriff's Department|San Diego Sheriff's Department]] announced that it believed that the McStays traveled to Mexico voluntarily.<ref name=voluntarily>{{cite news|last=Spagat |first=Elliot |title=Investigators say Missing McStay family left voluntarily |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/09/investigators-say-missing_n_3047938.html |newspaper=The Huffington Post |date=April 9, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209201542/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/09/investigators-say-missing_n_3047938.html |archivedate=December 9, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Unconfirmed sightings of the family were reported in Mexico and elsewhere, perpetuating hopes that they were safe and had left voluntarily.{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} Relatives of the McStays doubted that they would travel to Mexico, saying that Joseph and Summer avoided the country because of the safety threat posed by recent [[Mexican Drug War|drug wars]].<ref name="disappearance deepens" /> Other critics of the theory noted that the McStays had more than $100,000 in bank accounts, with no withdrawal of funds in preparation for a trip, and their accounts were untouched after their disappearance. Summer's sister said Summer's [[passport]] was expired.<ref>{{cite news|last=Martinez|first=Edecio|title=McStay Family Update: FBI Joins Search for Missing Family|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/mcstay-family-update-fbi-joins-search-for-missing-family/|publisher=CBS News|date=April 2, 2010}}</ref> Although it is possible for a U.S. citizen to enter Mexico without a passport, one is required to reenter the United States.
Summer had been known by a number of names. Born "Virginia Lisa Aranda", she had also been known as "Summer Martelli", "Summer Aranda-Martelli", "Lisa Aranda", "Lisa Martelli" and "Lisa Aranda-Martelli". In an early video interview, her mother confirmed that Martelli was the surname of Summer's stepfather, but it was later alleged to have been invented by Summer.{{citation needed|date=July 2014}} In a February 25, 2010 ''Valley News'' article, Sheriff's Lieutenant Dennis Brugos confirmed that Summer McStay had used various names including her stepfather's last name of Martelli, although she was never adopted by him.<ref name="valley news">{{cite news|last1=Ramsey|first1=Debbie|title=Authorities distribute 'endangered missing' flier pertaining to missing McStay family|url=http://www.myvalleynews.com/story/45499/|newspaper=The Valley News|date=February 25, 2010}}</ref> She took ten years off her age, although there was no confirmation that she used the alternative birthdate on any legal document. Family members insisted that the name change was only a facet of Summer's mental illness.<ref name="mother interview">{{cite news|last=Ramsey|first=Debbie|title=Mothers of McStays determined to find family|url=http://www.myvalleynews.com/story/46479/|newspaper=The Valley News|date=March 25, 2010}}</ref><ref name="cbs8">{{cite news|title=Search for Missing Fallbrook family continues|url=http://www.cbs8.com/story/12025015/search-for-missing-fallbrook-family-continues|publisher=CBS 8 San Diego|date=February 22, 2010}}</ref>
Investigators and the public also focused on McStay's business partner, Chase Merritt, who was the last known person to have had contact with Joseph McStay, and was the first to notice his disappearance. According to state records, Merritt had [[felony]] convictions for [[burglary]] and [[receiving stolen property]]. His most recent felony conviction, in 2001, was for the theft of $32,000 worth of welding and drilling equipment from San Gabriel Valley Ornamental Iron Works in [[Monrovia, California]]. An acquaintance of Merritt's told a San Diego reporter, "I think police should look at him and anyone associated with him."<ref name="cbs8" /><ref name="Gotfredson">{{cite news|last=Gotfredson|first=David|title=McStay family Mystery: Who is Chase Merritt|url=http://www.cbs8.com/story/24245580/mcstay-murder-mystery-who-is-chase-merritt|publisher=CBS 8 San Diego|date=December 17, 2013}}</ref>
In 2013, Merritt acknowledged he had spent more than an hour with Joseph McStay the day the McStay family went missing.<ref name="sbsun.com">{{Cite news|url=http://www.sbsun.com/general-news/20170721/tentative-trial-date-set-for-mcstay-family-murder-suspect-chase-merritt|title=Tentative trial date set for McStay family murder suspect 'Chase' Merritt|access-date=2017-07-24|language=en}}</ref> Merritt, who reportedly was the last person McStay called from his cell phone, also said that he had passed a polygraph exam and did not know anything that could help solve the mystery of the family's disappearance.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-mcstay-family-mystery-20131120-story.html |title=Man last phoned by McStay father says he took polygraph test |newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=November 20, 2013}}</ref> When asked if he thought Merritt was a suspect, Joseph McStay's father Patrick said, "I have to have faith in Chase because I have to have faith in my son. I believe that he (Joseph McStay) trusted Chase and believed in Chase. Do I think Chase is involved? I don't think so, and I truly hope not."<ref name="Gotfredson"/>
In January, 2014, Merritt said that he might write a book about the family, alleging that Summer had anger issues and that Joseph had been ill for some time with a mysterious ailment. Joseph McStay's family confirmed that Joseph had an unexplained illness and that Summer was possessive of her husband, but they called Merritt's suggestion that she was responsible for his illness unfounded. Joseph's father Patrick said, "I truly believe she loved my son."<ref name="richard allyn">{{cite news|last=Allyn|first=Richard|title=Backlash over book's new theory on McStay murders|url=http://www.cbs8.com/story/24380050/backlash-over-books-new-theory-on-mcstay-murders|publisher=CBS 8 San Diego|date=January 7, 2014}}</ref>
In 2013, local news reported that the McStay family had called Summer's ex-boyfriend, Vick W. Johansen, a person of interest in the case; the family believes email records demonstrate that Johansen was obsessed with Summer for years after their relationship ended. The McStays noted his criminal history (violent threats, felony vandalism, disturbing the peace, interfering with a business and resisting a [[peace officer]]) and a pattern of movement around the time of the disappearance that they considered suspicious. The San Diego Police Department had no comment on Johansen, defending its work in the case.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbs8.com/story/24256729/mcstay-murder-mystery-who-is-vick-johansen |title=McStay murder mystery: Who is Vick Johansen? |publisher=CBS 8 San Diego |date=December 19, 2013}}</ref>
== {{anchor|Arrest}}Arrest == On November 5, 2014, detectives from the San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department arrested Chase Merritt in connection with the deaths of the McStay family after discovering that his [[DNA profiling|DNA]] had been recovered from the McStays' car. His arrest was announced on November 7, 2014.<ref name="Los Angeles Times"/> Merritt is awaiting trial on four counts of murder, and the district attorney is seeking the [[death penalty]]. In July 2015, Merritt's defense attorney filed a request to have the case dismissed because of the wording used by the prosecution when the charges were filed.<ref name=SDU>{{cite news|last1=Figueroa|first1=Teri|title=Merritt attorneys want McStay case dismissed|url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/news/2015/jul/17/merritt-mcstay-demurrer-request-to-dismiss/|accessdate=August 23, 2015|work=[[U-T San Diego]]|date=July 17, 2015}}</ref>
According to arrest warrant affidavits filed in the case, autopsies concluded that all four victims had been beaten to death with a blunt object, and investigators believe the murder weapon was a 3-pound [[sledgehammer]], which was found in the grave containing the remains of Summer McStay and one of her sons. Investigators testified they believed the victims were tortured before they were killed.<ref name="Merritt fires attorneys">{{cite web|url=http://www.sbsun.com/general-news/20160121/mcstay-family-murder-suspect-charles-chase-merritt-fires-attorneys|title=McStay family murder suspect Charles 'Chase' Merritt fires attorneys |work=The Sun|location=San Bernardino |accessdate=February 18, 2016}}</ref>
Prosecutors allege that Merritt had a gambling problem, and killed the family for financial gain. They said that he wrote checks totalling more than $21,000 on Joseph McStay's business account in the days after they were killed, and then went on a gambling spree at nearby casinos, where he lost thousands of dollars.<ref name="Merritt fires attorneys"/>
Trial has been delayed as Merritt has repeatedly fired his attorney or attempted to represent himself. {{As of |2016|02}}, he had gone through five attorneys.<ref name="Merritt wants new attorneys">{{cite news |url=http://www.sbsun.com/general-news/20160211/mcstay-family-murder-suspect-charles-chase-merritt-wants-new-attorneys|title=McStay family murder suspect Charles 'Chase' Merritt wants new attorneys |newspaper=San Bernardino Sun |date=February 11, 2016 |accessdate=February 19, 2016}}</ref>
In January 2018, a trial setting conference was scheduled for 23 February.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sbsun.com/2018/01/12/san-bernardino-judge-allows-mcstay-family-murder-suspect-to-have-more-case-files-in-his-cell/|title=San Bernardino judge allows McStay family murder suspect to have more case files in his cell|date=January 12, 2018 |newspaper=San Bernardino Sun }}</ref> Merritt's attorney filed a motion in San Bernardino Superior Court on April 7, 2018, arguing that Joseph McStay's business and accounting records are [[Hearsay|hearsay evidence]] and therefore inadmissible.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sbsun.com/2018/05/02/lawyers-for-defendant-in-mcstay-family-murder-case-want-some-evidence-tossed/|title=Lawyers for defendant in McStay family murder case want some evidence tossed|date=May 2, 2018 |newspaper=San Bernardino Sun }}</ref> On May 4, the case was scheduled to go to trial in July 2018.<ref>{{cite news |first=Joe |last=Nelson |url=https://www.sbsun.com/2018/05/04/san-bernardino-judge-delays-ruling-on-bid-to-exclude-key-evidence-in-mcstay-family-murder-case/ |title=San Bernardino judge delays ruling in bid to exclude key evidence in McStay family murder case |newspaper=San Bernardino Sun |date=May 4, 2018 |accessdate=June 18, 2018 }}</ref>

{{infobox hieroglyphs |title = Meketaten |name = i-t:n:ra Aa16:D36:V31 t: B1 |name transcription = Maketaten
''mꜥkt itn'' |name explanation = ''Protected by Aten'' |image1 = Meketaten-Nefertiti.tiff |image1 width = 100px |image1 description = Meketaten on her mother's lap (left). }} [[File:Meketaten-FragmentaryStatue-BrooklynMuseum.png|thumb|right|Fragmentary [[quartzite]] statue of the Amarna princess Meketaten, from the reign of Akhenaten, circa 1352-1336 B.C. On display at the [[Brooklyn Museum]]. The broken hand over the figure's right breast was common to images depicting young girls, and likely once held a flower or rattle.]] '''Meketaten''' ("Behold the Aten" or "Protected by Aten") was the second daughter of six born to the Egyptian [[Pharaoh]] [[Akhenaten]] and his [[Great Royal Wife]] [[Nefertiti]]. She was probably born in year 4 of Akhenaten's reign. Although little is known about her, she is frequently depicted with her sisters accompanying her royal parents in the first two thirds of Akhenaten's reign. ==Family== Meketaten was the second daughter born to [[Akhenaten]] and [[Nefertiti]]. She had an older sister named [[Meritaten]] and four younger sisters named [[Ankhesenpaaten]], [[Neferneferuaten Tasherit]], [[Neferneferure]] and [[Setepenre (princess)|Setepenre]]. Tutankhaten was a half-brother.Dodson, Aidan and Hilton, Dyan. The Complete Royal Families of Ancient Egypt. Thames & Hudson. 2004. {{ISBN|0-500-05128-3}} ==Life== Meketaten’s approximate year of birth is in or before year 4 of Akhenaten.Tyldesley, Joyce. Nefertiti: Egypt's Sun Queen. Penguin. 1998. {{ISBN|0-670-86998-8}} Meketaten is first depicted on the walls of the ''Hut-benben'' temple dedicated to her mother Nefertiti in [[Thebes, Egypt|Thebes]]. Meketaten appears behind her older sister [[Meritaten]] in some of the later inscriptions, thought to date to year 4 or later.Redford, Donald B. Akhenaten: The Heretic King. Princeton University Press. 1987. {{ISBN|978-0-691-00217-0}} Further arguments to suggest Meketaten was born in or before year 4 come from the fact that her figure was added to one of the boundary stela recording events in year 4 and carved in year 5.Dodson, Aidan, Amarna Sunset: Nefertiti, Tutankhamun, Ay, Horemheb, and the Egyptian Counter-Reformation. The American University in Cairo Press. 2009, {{ISBN|978-977-416-304-3}} Meketaten moved to the new capital city Akhetaten with her family when she was still a small child. She is depicted in several of the tombs of the nobles in Amarna. Meketaten is depicted in the tomb of [[Ay]] holding a tray of gifts while wrapping one arm around her mother’s neck. Other monuments mentioning Meketaten include a stela from Heliopolis, a statue base from the Fayoum, and the tombs of Panehesy and Parennefer. Meketaten was depicted with her parents and sisters at the reception of foreign tributes – a ceremony dating to year 12 - that can be seen on several scenes in the private tombs in Amarna of high-ranking officials named Huya and High Priest Meryre II. ==Death and burial== Meketaten died in approximately year 14 of [[Akhenaten]]. It is very likely that a plague swept across Egypt between Akhenaten's 12th and 15th regnal years, for many members of the royal family cease to be mentioned again; among them Queen Mother [[Tiye]], Queen [[Nefertiti]], Akhenaten's secondary wife [[Kiya]], Meketaten and the two youngest princesses, [[Neferneferure]] and [[Setepenre (princess)|Setepenre]]. Meketaten's death could have resulted either from a plague, or from childbirth. The presence of a royal baby causes many to believe the young princess died in childbirth (in which case the father of the child would most likely be Akhenaten himself), but this cannot be proven. An alternative interpretation suggested by van Dijk is that the child depicted in the scenes is the soul (the ka) of Meketaten.5 [[File:Dibujo de tumba.jpg|575px|center|thumb|Meketaten under the canopy, on the wall paintings of the Chamber \gamma. In front of her: Akhenaten, Nefertiti, Meritaten, Ankhesenpaaten and Neferneferuaten Tasherit.]] Three chambers, denoted as Chambers \alpha, \ \beta and \gamma of the [[Royal Tomb of Akhenaten|Royal Tomb]] are believed to be used for the burials. Chambers \alpha and \gamma depict very similar scenes: Akhenaten and Nefertiti bend over the inert body of a woman, weeping and gripping each other's arms for support. Nearby a nurse stands with a baby in her arms, accompanied by a fan-bearer, which indicates the baby's royal status. The names in the scene in chamber \alpha have been hacked out. In the chamber \gamma however the hieroglyphs identify the dead young woman as Meketaten. In the same chamber another scene shows Meketaten standing under a canopy which is usually associated with childbirth but can also interpreted as representing the rebirth of the princess. In front of her, amongst courtiers, stand Akhenaten, Nefertiti and their three remaining daughters, Meritaten, Ankhesenpaaten and [[Neferneferuaten Tasherit]]. It is possible that chamber \alpha was the burial place of someone other than Meketaten. There may even have been two burials which may have been those of [[Neferneferure]] and [[Setepenre (princess)|Setepenre]], but this is not certain. Another theory is that one of the scenes depicts [[Kiya]] and that the baby is [[Tutankhamun]]. However, Jacobus Van Dijk, in a 2009 book in memory of the late William Murnane has demonstrated that this person was actually a symbolic depiction of the death and rebirth of Meketaten now with the god [[Aten]] in the afterlife.J. Van Dijk, [https://web.archive.org/web/20120322083908/http://cassian.memphis.edu/history/murnane/Van_Dijk.pdf The Death of Meketaten], in ''Causing His Name to Live: Studies in Egyptian Epigraphy and History in Memory of William J. Murnane'', ed.P. Brand and L. Cooper, Culture and history of the Ancient Near East 37. Leiden: Brill, 2009. John Harris also agrees with Van Dijk's conclusions according to the author. Fragments of Meketaten’s sarcophagus were found in the royal tomb. Inscriptions mention her parents [[Akhenaten]] and [[Nefertiti]], her sister [[Ankhesenpaaten]] as well as her grandparents [[Amenhotep III]] and [[Queen Tiye]].Murnane, William J., Texts from the Amarna Period in Egypt, Society of Biblical Literature, 1995 {{ISBN|1-55540-966-0}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Amarna Period Navigator}} [[Category:Amarna Period]] [[Category:Princesses of the Eighteenth Dynasty of Egypt]] [[Category:14th-century BC women]] [[Category:Deaths in childbirth]] [[Category:Akhenaten]] [[Category:Nefertiti]]

'''Millicent Borges Accardi'''{{cite web|url=http://www.millicentborgesaccardi.com/ |title=Millicent Borges Accardi |publisher=Millicent Borges Accardi |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} is a [[Portuguese-American]] poet{{cite web|url=http://poetsquarterly.yolasite.com/winter11_borgesaccardi2.php |title=Poets' Quarterly |website=Poetsquarterly.yolasite.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}}{{cite web|last=Akers |first=Mary |url=http://rkvryquarterly.com/interview-with-millicent-accardi/ |title=Interview with Millicent Accardi | Rkvry Quarterly Literary Journal |website=Rkvryquarterly.com |date=2012-01-22 |accessdate=2017-04-12}}{{cite web|url=http://portuguese-american-journal.com/poet-millicent-borges-accardi-reconnects-with-her-roots-interview-2/ |title=Poet Millicent Borges Accardi Reconnects with her Roots – Interview |publisher=Portuguese American Journal |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} who lives in California. She has received literary fellowships from the [[National Endowment for the Arts]] (NEA), Fulbright, [[CantoMundo]],{{cite web|url=http://www.cantomundo.org/cantomundo-fellows/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-10-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121128003710/http://www.cantomundo.org/cantomundo-fellows/ |archivedate=2012-11-28 |df= }} the [[California Arts Council]], [[Barbara Deming]] Foundation,{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/laura-baudo-sillerman/millicent-borges-accardi_b_606404.html |title=Millicent Borges Accardi: Woman on a Shaky Bridge |publisher=The Huffington Post |date=2011-05-25 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} and Formby Special Collections at [[Texas Tech University]] for research on the writer/activist Key Boyle. Her full-length poetry collection is ''Only More So'', (Salmon Poetry, Ireland), ''Injuring Eternity'' and Practical Love Poems (forthcoming) are with World Nouveau{{cite web|url=http://www.worldnouveau.com/World_Nouveau/World_Nouveau_Inc..html |title=World Nouveau Inc |website=Worldnouveau.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} She also has a [[chapbook]], ''Woman on a Shaky Bridge'', with Finishing Line Press.{{cite web|url=https://www.finishinglinepress.com/index.php?osCsid=jbqmbuefrp1iujr01t2pafcj66 |title=Finishing Line Press |publisher=Finishing Line Press |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Her articles can be found at ''The Writers Chronicle'', [[Association of Writers & Writing Programs]]. ''Poets Quarterly'',{{cite web|url=http://poetsquarterly.yolasite.com/|title=Poets' Quarterly|publisher=}}{{cite web|last=May |first=Lori A. |url=http://www.poetsquarterly.com/2014/04/q-with-robert-manaster-by-millicent.html |title=Poets' Quarterly: Q&A with Robert Manaster by Millicent Borges Accardi |website=Poetsquarterly.com |date=2014-04-19 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} ''The Portuguese American Journal'',{{cite web|url=http://portuguese-american-journal.com/about/ |title=About |publisher=Portuguese American Journal |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} ''Portuguese-American Review'',[https://web.archive.org/web/20120112064716/http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=364]{{cite web|url=http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=391|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502094202/http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=391|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2 May 2012|title="Portugal: A Literary Secret" by Millicent Borges Accardi and Tony J. Roma - PORTUGUESE-AMERICAN REVIEW|date=2 May 2012|publisher=}} and ''The Topanga Messenger''.{{cite web|last=Borges |first=Millicent |url=http://www.topangamessenger.com/story_detail.php?ArticleID=5379 |title=At Heartbreak House, Things are Not as They Seem |publisher=Topanga Messenger |date=2012-06-28 |accessdate=2017-04-12}}{{cite web|last=Borges |first=Millicent |url=http://www.topangamessenger.com/story_detail.php?ArticleID=6146 |title=The Royal Family: Sometimes Blood is Thicker than Usual |publisher=Topanga Messenger |date=2013-07-11 |accessdate=2017-04-12}}{{cite web|last=Borges |first=Millicent |url=http://www.topangamessenger.com/story_detail.php?ArticleID=6290|title=Tone Deaf : News, the Media and Joyce Carol Oates' Play|publisher=Topanga Messenger |date=2013-09-19 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Interview subjects have included Grammy Director [[Michael Greene (arts)|Michael Greene]]; poets [[W.S. Merwin]]{{cite web|url=http://poetry.about.com/u/sty/poetsbynamem/Encounters-With-W-S-Merwin-And-His-Poems/Having-Breakfast-With-Merwin.htm |title=W.S. Merwin – Profile of the poet W.S. Merwin |website=Poetry.about.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} and [[Carl Dennis]]; writers [[Frank X. Gaspar]], [[Sam Pereira]],{{cite web|url=http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=424|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120424195400/http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=424|dead-url=yes|archive-date=24 April 2012|title="Sam Pereira: The Real Thing" by Millicent Borges Accardi - PORTUGUESE-AMERICAN REVIEW|date=24 April 2012|publisher=}} Jacinto Lucas Pires, Donna Freitas (Sex and the Soul), and [[Nuno Júdice]];{{cite web|url=http://portuguese-american-journal.com/nuno-judice-one-of-portugals-greatest-literary-treasures-interview/ |title=Nuno Júdice: One of Portugal's greatest literary treasures – Interview |publisher=Portuguese American Journal |date=2012-08-06 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Paulette Rapp (daughter of The Bickersons writer), [[Stephen Rebello]] (Alfred Hitchcock and the Making of Psycho), playwright Bill Bozzone, CantoMundo, and Portuguese-American scholar Deolinda Adão.{{cite web|url=http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=548|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150623055933/http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=548|dead-url=yes|archive-date=23 June 2015|title="Gender Bias, the Literary Canon and the Future of Portuguese Literature: an interview with Deolinda Adão" by Millicent Borges Accardi - PORTUGUESE-AMERICAN REVIEW|date=23 June 2015|publisher=}} Borges Accardi's work has appeared in over 50 publications,{{cite web|last=Baudo |first=Laura |url=http://womensvoicesforchange.org/millicent-borges-accardi-woman-on-a-shaky-bridge.htm |title=Millicent Borges Accardi: Woman on a Shaky Bridge | Women's Voices For Change |website=Womensvoicesforchange.org |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} including ''[[Nimrod]]'', ''[[Tampa Review]]'', ''[[New Letters]]'' and ''[[The Wallace Stevens Journal]]'', as well as in ''Boomer Girls'' (Iowa Press) and ''Chopin with Cherries'' (Moonrise Press) anthologies. Artist residencies include [[Yaddo]], Jentel, Vermont Studio, Fundación Valparaíso in [[Mojacar]], [[Milkwood (Český Krumlov)|Milkwood]] in [[Český Krumlov]], CZ and Disquiet in Lisbon, Portugal. She received degrees in English and literature from [[California State University, Long Beach|California State University, Long Beach (CSULB)]], holds a Masters in Professional Writing from the [[University of Southern California]] (USC). She was named after the ''[[Millicent Library]]'' in Fairhaven, MA. Borges Accardi also works as a freelance writer (technical writing and instructional design). ==Reading series== In 2012, Millicent Accardi started the "Kale Soup for the Soul"{{cite web|url=http://www.mundoportugues.org/error/404 |title=Página não encontrada :: Mundo Português |website=Mundoportugues.org |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} reading series featuring Portuguese-American writers. The first edition was in Chicago{{cite web|url=http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=397|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120326025933/http://www.portugueseamericanreview.com/?p=397|dead-url=yes|archive-date=26 March 2012|title="Kale Soup for the Soul" March 2nd in Chicago (Update) - PORTUGUESE-AMERICAN REVIEW|date=26 March 2012|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagoreader.com/chicago/kale-soup-for-the-soul/Event?oid=5754017 |title=Kale Soup for the Soul | Chicago Cultural Center, Washington Room | Literary Events |publisher=[[Chicago Reader]] |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} at the famous [[Chicago Cultural Center]]. Since then, "Kale Soup for the Soul" readings have featured over 25 different writers, in regional readings in cities such as San Francisco,{{cite web|url=http://events.sfgate.com/san_francisco_ca/events/show/370117185-kale-soup-for-the-soul-with-poet-frank-gaspar |title=SFGate: San Francisco Bay Area - News, Bay Area news, Sports, Business, Entertainment, Classifieds - SFGate |website=Events.sfgate.com |date=2011-12-05 |accessdate=2017-04-12}}{{cite web|url=http://arteinstitute.org/posts/view/648/34 |title=Kale Soup for the Soul |publisher=Arte Institute |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Seattle,{{cite web|url=http://www.thestranger.com/events/18907795/kale-soup-for-the-soul-awp-event |title=Kale Soup for the Soul AWP Event at Seattle Public Library. Green Lake Branch in Seattle, WA on Sat., March 1, 4 p.m. 2014 - Seattle Readings & Talks Events Calendar |publisher=The Stranger |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Iowa City, Providence, Rhode Island,{{cite web|url=http://ojornal.com/portuguese-brazilian-news/2013/11/kale-soup-for-the-soul-poetry-series-coming-to-mass-and-r-i/#axzz36mqq8KDt |title=O Jornal |publisher=O Jornal |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} Boston{{cite web|url=http://portuguese-american-journal.com/poetry-kale-soup-for-the-soul-literary-series-2013-boston-ma/ |title=Poetry: 2013 Kale Soup for the Soul literary series – Boston, MA |publisher=Portuguese American Journal |date=2013-01-22 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} and San José{{cite web|url=http://historysanjose.org/wp/events/kale-soup-for-the-soul-literary-reading/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-07-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714212404/http://historysanjose.org/wp/events/kale-soup-for-the-soul-literary-reading/ |archivedate=2014-07-14 |df= }}{{cite web|author= |url=http://portuguesebooks.org/2014/01/literary-reading-in-san-jose-by-portuguese-american-writers-and-poets/ |title=LITERARY READING IN SAN JOSE BY PORTUGUESE-AMERICAN WRITERS AND POETS | Portuguese Heritage Publications |website=Portuguesebooks.org |date=2014-01-23 |accessdate=2017-04-12}}—as part of a new wave of Portuguese-American Literature. In 2013, there were "Kale Soup for the Soul" readings at the [[Mass Poetry Festival]] in Salem, the [[Valente Library]] in Cambridge, and the Portuguese Consulate in Boston.{{cite web|url=https://www.awpwriter.org/awp_conference/archive/2013/offsite |title=Association of Writers & Writing Programs |website=Awpwriter.org |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} There were also readings at [[Brown University]], UMass Dartmouth, and Rhode Island College as well as workshops with local students from Shea high school in Rhode Island (80 students in attendance). There was a conference in Lisbon which featured a panel about Portuguese-American Literature as well as a round table with many of the writers who have participated in "Kale Soup for the Soul". ==Works== Poetry collections: * ''Only More So'' (Salmon Poetry, 2016) {{cite web|url=http://www.salmonpoetry.com/details.php?ID=389&a=281|title=salmonpoetry.com - Only More So by Millicent Borges Accardi|website=www.salmonpoetry.com}} * ''Injuring Eternity'' (Mischievous Muse Press, December, 2010){{cite web|url=http://catalog.loc.gov/cgi-bin/Pwebrecon.cgi?Search_Arg=Millicent%20Borges%20Accardi&Search_Code=GKEY%5E*&CNT=100&PID=tk5Hh3XvLTXmNKInFZZz-eSpu8fb |title=Library of Congress Online Catalog - Legacy Catalog Retired |website=Catalog.loc.gov |date=2015-12-01 |accessdate=2017-04-12}} * ''Practical Love Poems'' (forthcoming) Chapbooks: * ''Woman on a Shaky Bridge'' (Finishing Line Press, 2010){{cite web|url=http://poetsquarterly.yolasite.com/winter11_borgesaccardi.php |title=Poets' Quarterly |website=Poetsquarterly.yolasite.com |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}} ==Awards== 2015: Fulbright Fellowship for Poetry {{cite web|url=http://www.cies.org/grantee/millicent-accardi |title=Millicent Accardi | Fulbright Scholar Program |website=Cies.org |date= |accessdate=2017-04-12}}
